net.asrex.skillful.pack

Class PerkPack

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.asrex.skillful.pack.PerkPack
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AllPerkPacksPerkPack

    public abstract class PerkPack
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a perk pack, which allows for third-party mods to dynamically create some number of custom PerkDefinition instances in bulk.

    Skill and perk packs are, like their associated individual definitions, loaded at the request of the end-user from the configuration file by use of a YAML !tag. Packs may accept an arbitrary number of configuration parameters set by the configuration parser at load time using JavaBean-compatible getter and setter methods.

    PerkPack classes should be registered with the PerkRegistry during FML initialization to be made available to configuration files when they are parsed. Additionally, PerkPack classes must have a no-args constructor to allow automatic construction to occur.

    Note that due to a requirement of the YAML parser (SnakeYAML), classes loaded from !tag declarations must have at least one set property to avoid an error. For packs that do not require any additional configuration, users may specify dummy: true after the !tag declaration to correctly instantiate the skill pack without any other configuration parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • createPerkDefintions

        public abstract java.util.List<PerkDefinition> createPerkDefintions()
        Called during perk initialization to request the list of perks added from this perk pack. These perks definitions will be appended to the global list of perk definitions within the PerkRegistry and made available for user purchase.

        Subclasses may return any desired list of (uniquely named) skills, and may optionally make use of user-specified parameters when constructing the definitions.

        Returns:
        a list of new PerkDefinition instances
